page.title: 02THE BARRINGTON AREA
page.content: { The area surveyed includes the villages of Barrington,Stocklinch & Puckington,& the settlements of Ilford & S.Bradon.The area is mostly low lying & parts are subject to flooding by the River Isle.There is a ridge of upland stretching from the west at Puckington to the east near Shepton Beauchamp.Barrington lies to the N of the ridge & Stocklinch to the S.The land is fertile, principally used for agriculture.It is well wooded inspite of the loss of elms.There are small copses of young trees & apple orchards.
